1. Open Floor Plan: To create a modern office space, an open floor plan is one of the important design solutions. This can include removing any existing walls and creating large open spaces that can accommodate different departments and activities in the building.

2. Natural Light: Natural lighting is another essential design feature that is desired in modern offices. This can be done by preserving existing windows and enlarging them to allow more light to enter the building. As well as incorporating skylights, or light wells.

3. Industrial Elements: The industrial character of the old factory building can be preserved and emphasized by incorporating industrial elements like exposed brickwork, beams, and pipes. These features can be highlighted in contrast to modern elements to create a unique work environment. Using salvaged steel and wood from the original building can also create an authentic look.

4. Colour Scheme: A modern colour scheme can be used to create a fresh and modern look while enhancing the heritage features of the building. This can be achieved by using bold and vibrant colours that complement the exposed brick and concrete elements.

5. Green Spaces: Green spaces can be added to the office by planting gardens, using biophilic design which includes live plants, moss walls or green walls. Having plants inside the building not only improves the interior air quality but provides a calming atmosphere.

6. Flexible Spaces: Incorporate flexible spaces, rooms or furniture that can be easily moved or repositioned. Providing breakout spaces and collaborative spaces for collaborative work can encourage innovation and knowledge sharing among employees.

7. Sustainable Materials: Sustainable materials can be used to create a modern and environmentally friendly office. Materials like reclaimed wood, bamboo, or ECO friendly recycled building materials can be used throughout the design process to reduce the environmental footprint of the renovation.

8. Add Artwork and Historical elements: Incorporating artwork and historical features throughout the building, such as murals, vintage signage, and photographs of the previous factory’s operations could convey the history of the building and the community. This would create a sense of belonging and connection for the employees working there.

9. Technology Integration: Install high-tech modern furniture such as adjustable height desks, ergonomic chairs, and smart technology throughout the building, such as video conferencing devices, or smart sensors for climate control that are designed for energy efficiency, security and employee comfort. 

10. Public space integration: The surrounding areas of the factory building need not be neglected. When transforming an old factory building into an office space, consider creating public spaces or amenities within them, such as bike storage, outdoor areas for employees, or co-working spaces for the wider community. This will not only provide a pleasant work environment but also create a vibrant and welcoming space for everyone to enjoy.
